meanings.definition: To cause someone to be no longer friendly or close to another person or group
meanings.sent1: His constant lies were estranging his friends.
meanings.sent2: The argument ended up estranging the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The misunderstanding was estranging them, but they quickly resolved it.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words spoken in anger were estranging their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal was so deep that it was truly estranging their bond.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel that they are different and not part of a group
meanings.sent1: The new student felt estranging stares from his classmates.
meanings.sent2: Being the only one without a costume was estranging her from the Halloween party.
meanings.sent3: His unique fashion sense was estranging him from the traditional crowd.
meanings.sent4: The unfamiliar language was estranging her from understanding the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The peculiar behavior was estranging him from fitting in with the rest of the team.
